WRITING.TITLE: [Serious] Daters of Reddit: What are the ways people approach Valentine's Day when they're just beginning to date someone?

[Serious] Daters of Reddit: What's the best way to approach Valentine's Day when you're just beginning to date someone? It seems weird to celebrate love when you're still in the process of figuring that out, but it's also seems weird to do nothing.
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

Newborns also "smile." But though we take them to be smiling, they don't think they are (hence the "consciously"). The fine point is that there is nothing that stops any baby from smiling; it is a matter of when they intend to smile, and how they come about doing so on command.
I'm sure that smiling as an expression of joy is something not foreign to blind children. Still, the mimicing of facial expression is not a nonfactor in how sighted babies come to intentionally smile. So your counterexample does not actually invalidate the piece above or my point; they're not mutually exclusive.
At least that is how I understand it.

WRITING.TITLE: TIL that babies do not consciously smile until they are at least six weeks old. Before they do, they mimic the facial expressions of their parents. Such developments are important because they indicate how babies become aware of their social world.

LPT: If you're borrowing someone's phone to make a call, and it goes to voicemail, leave a message. Makes it less likely that the person will call back and have an awkward conversation with someone they do not know.

LPT: If applying to PhD programs, do an independent study the semester before applications in the fall. You'll have a writing sample you can polish in the summer, leaving time for other application materials.
WRITING.TEXT:
This was huge for me. Spent the summer writing personal statements/statements of purpose and studying for the GRE. Applied to 14 programs, got into 7things worked out.
NOTE: This will most likely apply to those who are applying straight from undergrad. For non-trad PhD apps: do leave tips in the comments.
